title.narrative: KMG Transforming Lives Wmn Led Community 2012-2016
KMG Transforming Lives Wmn Led Community 2012-2016

description.narrative: KMG: - Arbetar mot könsbaserat våld, särskilt könsstympning av kvinnor och andra skadliga traditioner. - Förbättra sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa. - Skapa tillgång till utbildning för flickor och marginaliserade grupper, samt förbättra kvinnors ekonomiska egenmakt.

KMG´s work is focused on: - working against gender-based violence, in particular female genitale mutilation and other harmful traditional pracices. - Improve Sexual and Reproductive Health - Create access to eduvation for girls and marginalized groups. - Women´s economic empowerment.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
THis programme was part of a larger support to civil society organasations working for the strengthening of women and girls rights. KMG received SEK 10 000 000 for the time period of 2012-2015. The programme was no cost extended and the final activities were completed in November 2017. An final end audit was done and submitted to the Embassy in March 2018. The intervention will now be closed. The intervention has been exposed to an in-dept review and an end evaluation. Both concluded that the programme was relevant, that it addressed critical needs of women and it also addressed the nexus of poverty and the marginalisation of women by supoorting livelihood interventions targeting women and girls. The intervention has mainly operated in the Southern Region The goal of the programme was to reduce and eliminate GBV including harmful traditional practices. The subgoals and results were: 1. Reduce FGM by 50-75% in the intervention areas Girls' clubs and a large number of capacity building interventions have been carried out to reduce FGM. Skills training, economic empowerment, information sharing on the negative consequences of FGM. A substantial reduction of FGM has been obtained. Some sort of FGM has been eliminated entirely and some FGM has just been reduced. The results varies in the different zones they have been operating. 2. Improved women and girls' empowerment In this component a significant focus has been on strengthening women's leadership and decision making capabilities. this has resulted in among others that the women had taken increased responsibilities and new roles in the village/workplace. An increase in women taken their cases to court could also be attributed to the new empowerment. 3. Sustainability of social changes ensured This component put focus on strengthening women to get organised and working together in groups. It assisted to create 7 leadership groups, 149 Kebele and Wereda groups, 271 ant-HPT clubs, 104 women and girls's saving clubs to mention a few. Other results were also increased engagement among the women in local level planning and budgeting.
Improved capacity of community action learning center An important component of the programme was also to strengthen the government stakeholders' capacity to respond to the increased demand from the communities. Capacity building activities were conducted for these groups. Consultation meetings were facilitated. The interaction and collaboration between citizens and government officials on issues related to violence, FGM and HTP were improved. Reduced environmental degradation. This component included land rehabilitation, seedling production, seedling planting, promotion of environmentally friendly horticultural crops, introduction of fuel saving stoves. These interventions have resulted in a more diversified agriculture, an agriculture that take the environment into consideration, more entrepreneurship skills among the target groups and organisation of women on coopratives.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
